resources.string: Please choose the type of news you are interested in:
More than 1,000 migrants rescued in Italy over the weekend

In Italy, disagreements between regional governments hold back actions to deal with the migration crisis. The situation worsens as the days go by. Just this weekend, almost 1,000 migrants were rescued in the Mediterranean Sea.
Australian man charged with allegedly feeding intelligence to Chinese spies

Alexander Csergo, 55, was arrested in Bondi Beach, a Sydney suburb, on April 14, accused of receiving money from two spies he allegedly knew by the code names "Ken" and "Evelyn" in exchange for information.
Effects on the reforms of a possible rupture in the government coalition
Experts say that if it does not withstand the pressure and breaks, there would be a paralysis of the legislative management
The dollar with a lot of movement
The minimum price of the currency during this Monday, April 17, was 4,410 pesos.
AI is not about humanitys dominance over nature, but about relinquishing its control.
AI advance scares and puts humanity on guard
More than 1,000 experts called for a six-month moratorium in order to think about how to regulate it.
